messages.title: Greens Fight for a Fairer Britain

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Matthew Butcher is calling for a fairer way to fund higher education; changing the current, unfair system and promoting government funding over putting young people into debt.

Matthew will fight for a world-class transport system that everyone can afford; massive improvement in transport nationally and locally, support for extension of the tram between University Park and the city centre, and advocating for cheaper bus fares and a 10% drop in rail fares.

The Green Party stands for a fully funded excellent health service, including free dental care, free eye tests, single sex wards and shorter waiting times for everyone. They believe that top quality healthcare is a right and must be defended.

issues.education: Matthew Butcher is standing for parliament in Nottingham, is calling for 'a fairer way to fund higher education'.
issues.health: The Green Party stance for a fully funded excellent health service.

images.caption: Matthew Butcher with a supporter at Crocus Cafe

leaflet.additionalNotes: Leaflet published and promoted by Chris Dixon for Nottingham Green Party.
